website_summaries.verdict: Logitech finally earns a CNET Editors' Choice award with this update to its flagship gaming mouse. An extra thumb button, an updated laser sensor, and more convenient and flexible customization options than the competition make this mouse easy to recommend to any PC gamer.
pros: Easy to use, on-the-fly sensitivity changer
updated design includes two thumb-side buttons
cons: Thin thumb buttons might be tough to use for those with large hands
electric-blue styling reminds us of a SpikeTV sports drink commercial (for some this might be a "good")

customer_reviews.title: Love. This
customer_reviews.text: I. Love. This. Mouse. I've had it since 2009 and it's still kicking. It's still accurate and all of the buttons still work perfectly. It's extremely durable and has seen very heavy use. I did have to replace the cable since the drag eventually pulled the old one loose. The replacement was easy and not it works just like I bought it yesterday. This mouse is my baby, I love the cracked blue design and everything else about this mouse. Logitech doesn't make this mouse anymore, but if you can get your hands on one of these. It's totally worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle and Ashley

customer_reviews.title: A Classic.
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech G series of mice have been around for over a decade and I still own a few of them that are 8 years old and still function. Sadly though this is about the extent of their life and either the cables, buttons, or sensor goes out, but byt then it's probably time for a new mouse anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite mouse of the dozen or so that I have owned. It has a very solid, substantial feel in my above average sized hand. I really like the adjustable weights. The extra weight gives a sense of better control, and a standard mouse feels cheap and flimsy in comparison. The button right on the mouse to change the sensitivity of your cursor movement is a nice feature, and the mouse is very comfortable in my hand and very accurate and precise to use. Very worthwhile if you are a gamer, or if you have large hands and feel constricted by the size of a standard mouse.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tobias

customer_reviews.title: Right-Click Failure
customer_reviews.text: This was the greatest gaming mouse I had ever used. Simple and "comfy". It had a failure of the right button, which would insert a double right-click nearly every other press of the button. Settings and re-installation of the driver did nothing. Other Logitech mice worked fine with the same driver and settings. Logitech of course refused to acknowledge a failure of the device and assumed my settings were inaccurate, regardless my efforts to trouble shoot. I had to quit using it and I would not buy another at this price ... why pay Zippo prices for a Bic lighter?
customer_reviews.author: William B. Steele

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this in 2015 for $60
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the prices on these have skyrocketed! I purchased this brand new on Amazon in 2015 for $60. I should have kept it in the box but my original G5 scroll wheel from 2005 started failing. I don't think I can ever use another mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Ian D.

customer_reviews.title: Feature-rich, but flawed design
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has some very attractive features, but also has a number of problems that make it very frustrating to use. The cord is awkward and catches on table edges, interfering with motion at times. The glide pads wear away easily. A little bit of dust can turn the mouse cursor into a jittery mess, and the optical sensor is buried within the mouse in a way that makes it difficult to wipe clean.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wetuski

customer_reviews.title: I wish they still made this today!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned my G5 mouse since 2003 and without a doubt it is one of the best mice I've ever owned. I shudder at the idea that sooner or later I will have to replace it. Yes, I am still using it today and I have absolutely 0 complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Hyrules Hero

customer_reviews.title: ... have this mouse to this day and its running like new. Precise
customer_reviews.text: Still have this mouse to this day and its running like new. Precise, well made, and has a weight system that allows you to customize the feel you like. The buttons work good as new, and the only thing that has degraded is the Logitech symbol at the base of the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro L.

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming mouse period!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few including the G500, which I still own and use at work, the Cyborg Rat 7 (gimmicks nothing more), the Razer Naga (some heft please), the G700 (ehh) and I've always come back to my tried and true G5. I use all buttons including the side-scroll buttons and, combined with the weight and perfect ergos, this mouse has just worked perfect from jump start. I was trying to replace it because the app-specific button programming kinda sucks but I guess I'll have to live with that since all the others I tried don't stack up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After a year of use, still functioning perfect
customer_reviews.text: Nice gaming mouse. The weights that you insert into the body of the mouse really gets you a perfect weight. I resent software upgrade did fix the one pesky glitch on the mouse. Before, every time you rebooted, you would have to reset the speed, easy to do, but was jut annoying. The software patch fixed it. The cord is super light weight, and corded mice are much better for gaming or CAD design. Cordless mich lose LOS and are not as responsive. Overall, after a year of use, it has proven to be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Alek

customer_reviews.title: Great for RSI sufferers
customer_reviews.text: I am a repetitive strain sufferer who works at at the computer 10+ hours a day. I've tried a ton of mice now, both optical and laser, and even tried using a Wacom Tablet for a while. This has been the one that has helped the most with pain. The profile of the mouse is low which helps to maintain a more natural hand posture. Even though the customizable weight cartridge is meant for gamers, it also works great for RSI since one can play around with the weights until they feel most comfortable. And the precision tracking means less effort trying to move the mouse to the target. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: duetbetter

customer_reviews.title: My 2 Cents
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is a very good and sensitive mouse because you can set the sensitivity yourself. I like how you can choose the little weights to place inside your mouse on the bottom side, which lets you customize the feel to where you are happy. If I had to do it all over again I would still buy this mouse. I use it for games that need high precision, counterstrike, to games such as warcraft 3: frozen throne. So if you are in need of a gaming mouse like I was I would definitely whole heartedly recommend this mouse. Good Gaming Everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Chang

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: My logitech wireless mouse died and I had a few problems with connection issues. So I decided I would go back to a wire mouse. I want a mouse that had almost the exact same button setup as my wireless mouse. Friend of mine has the MX5** version. I was looking for that one put I didn't chose it because of the color schemes that amazon was selling at the time. I am very picky. So I went with the G5 instead. I am very happy that I bought this mouse instead. I played with the weights to get the mouse the right fell when playing FPS's, and works for everything else I play on the PC also.
customer_reviews.author: David Noonan

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my brother in 2008. He is left handed, so it didn't work out for him. He returned it for a razor. However, I really liked the mouse. For the price it felt very solid and if I wasn't so attached to my wireless setup (my desk is awkward with wires) I would have kept using it. I can't comment on how long it lasts because we returned it, but in my experience logitech products hold up for at least a couple years, which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Sambardo

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming and all around mouse
customer_reviews.text: Logitech has really nailed it with this one. Great all around and gaming mouse. Comfortable grip and thumb groove. The buttons have a nice responsive and positive feel to them, and I like the adjustable weights to get that "Just right" feel to the movement. The change on the fly sensitivity is cool, but seems a little too spaced out at 400-800-2000. I think it is adjustable to whatever you want, but I have not gotten a chance to play with those settings yet.
customer_reviews.author: DickLloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Am an IT person and just wanted a good working mouse. Asked around and this was the one recommended. So far it has met all my requirements. Sensistive index button, extra buttons, high sensitivity, work on any surface. The variable weight thing is a bit much, but I won't complain. Only thing I didn't like was the very stiff cord. Not sure why they did that. The Internet price makes it a best deal. I would definitley recommended this one for any serious user.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: Like it even better than G9
customer_reviews.text: I am a computer programmer - so I use computers for many hours a day. This is my favorite mouse so far, and I have also used the G9 mouse. The G9 is great except that I did not find it comfortable when using for long periods of time so I went back to a G5. Furthermore, I really like the way this mouse lets you switch DPI on the fly with the buttons on the mouse... and the tracking is excellent. Logitech also has excellent warranty service.
customer_reviews.author: Lantana Al

customer_reviews.title: <<Oh Yeah>>
customer_reviews.text: Been using the mouse for a good month now. The good stuff... -Very responsive and accurate tracking -Feels damn good in my hand -Buttons are perfectly placed -Very flexable and adjustable cable -Large Polytetrafluoroethylene feet make it glide The bad stuff... -None Yet Comments... I used to own a Razer product but didn't care for the feel or quality and it didn't last very long. I never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: plasticlizard

customer_reviews.title: G5 - comfortable and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I wore out my first G5 and HAD to get another one. I use mine to play a few PC games, particularly Battlefield 2142 where controlling the TV-guided missile requires a more "professional" mouse. It has a very ergonomic feel to it, more buttons that I have a use for and most importantly it has an on-the-fly sensitivity button that lets you quickly change the sensitivity settings. All that without having to mess around with any software. I have tried many different mice, and although this model is somewhat old it still does the best job for me. I highly recommend this mouse, especially for a PC Gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Sloppy Joe Drippins

customer_reviews.title: THEE Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't ask for a more solid, smooth handling mouse, especially for gaming. The customizable weight tray that inserts inside the mouse to give you just the right weight for your personal preference for gaming plus the "on-the-fly" DPI switching from 400-800-2000 is simply awesome. As anyone who plays games on their PC, especially FPS games, knows, one mouse doesn't always work as well in all situations. THIS mouse does. I highly recommend it. I bought one for myself first, then for my wife's computer and then for my cousin to go with his new gamin' laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Shane C. Van Noy

customer_reviews.title: Counter-Strike Mouse/FPS Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to replace my Razer Copperhead 2000dpi mouse. It was a good replacement, a bit heavier than the copperhead. Sometimes the dpi buttons don't work correctly. Driver's are okay--not great. After a year of use, the mouse shorts out sometimes and the dpi will stick when alt tabbing between windows. sometimes it will stay stuck on the lowest setting and vice versa. the "adjustable" weight is actually a useless feature as the mouse is already a heavy one for most types of gaming. adding additional weights to the mouse or pretending to create a custom weight for your hand adds strain to your wrist and you will notice the damage that it causes over time. carporal tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Enonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great gamming mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has great balance and with the add-on weights, really allows you to get the feel you want. The added feature of the top mounted in-game sensitivity switch for in game switching of sensitivity is a plus. Get instant access to three sensitivity levels -- 400 dpi, 800 dpi, and 2000 dpi. Shift from pixel-precise targeting to fast-twitch maneuvers without pausing the action. Very nice feel and control. Best mouse I've owned yet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Divis

customer_reviews.title: Feel is important
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse for someone who suffers badly from arthritis, a feeling of having something to drag is essential. The textured feel is probably more subtle to arthritic fingers. The others that came before this were just too light. Well loaded with weights I've not heard a complaint about the smoothness and accuracy of movement. At first the sensitivity of the buttons was an issue, more positive less touch could be easier to master. The motion is heavy yet smooth and the button touch is light, but over time that has become more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not ideal .........
customer_reviews.text: The new G5 is not bad at all. The "dpi on the fly" buttons can and should be programed for other functions. I prefer weighting it with all the 4.5 gram ingots for the most solid base possible. Very flighty without any weights whatsoever. Only thing is, Microsoft just put out their double thumb button mouse that positions the buttons over/under each other and there is no need to stretch the thumb to reach the further button of the two !!! I want to try Microsofts mouse now as it looks to be a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: _Rupicolous*

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse a lot. I was searching for a nice wired mouse because I don't like having to recharge the wireless one. I am not a hardcore gamer, but I really enjoyed being able to select the weight of the mouse to suit my comfort. My favorite thing about this mouse is that the tracking speed is adjustable right on the mouse without needing any operating system drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A. Mefford

customer_reviews.title: EXCELENT
customer_reviews.text: Excelent mouse, you can adjust DPI for win, games or some aplications that you have like desing... This mouse have a extraordinary and ergonomic desing, it's beautifull and is LOGITECH! Excelente mouse, ajustable para aplicaciones como games, diseno, o simplemente trabajar en windows. Tremento diseno ergonomico y expectacular a la vista, la verdad otra tremenda compra Aparte es LOITECH, que mas quieres en tu vida?
customer_reviews.author: A. ROJAS

customer_reviews.title: Much better than what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a hardcore gamer a few years ago, even participating in national Counter Strike competitions in Brazil. But for study reasons I had to stop gaming. Now that I have more time I decided to build a very powerful computer and the only thing that I was lacking was a good mouse. Without hesitation, everyone reccomended me the G5, and after reading the reviews I was pretty convinced it was very good so I bought it. I must say that I'm really happy wiht it, for it is great for gaming and working! The only reccomendation I could give would be to use the included software to take full advantage of all the mouse abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Luis F. Vallese

customer_reviews.title: This mouse
customer_reviews.text: Best mouse I ever bought. It has been a couple years though, the decals are starting to come off (esp on the speed down button, but still in good condition. The only gripe I have is how slow the scrolling is on the scroll wheel, but no biggy I guess. So I reiterate, this is the best mouse I ever bought. Even if the weight gimmick is goofy as hell.
customer_reviews.author: S. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Fast & to the point.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this mouse, simply because you can set it to almost any-button configuration & DPI speed that you prefer. I'm a novice to PC's and... well, it's even a snap for me to set-up and use. It's a sweet laser mouse. I'd recommend it to anybody that enjoy's the gaming world. I use it with World of Warcraft... it's great. A must have!!
customer_reviews.author: Issac E. Howard Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect mouse
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my third G5 (this new blue one) for a new laptop. I've had two of the original G5s (one on my work PC and the other on my home desktop machine) for over two years. I do a lot of photo editing, and these G5s feel perfect to me. Being able to adjust the weight to individual taste, and being able to change speeds at the touch of a button, are brilliant touches.
customer_reviews.author: David Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I've used quite a few mice, and have found this to be the best to date. The size of the mouse is perfect for my hand (not too small) and is a very comfortable fit. The adjustable weighting makes this mouse even better by suiting to individual style. Well built and plenty of buttons make this an excellent gaming and general purpose mouse. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: A few minor problems
customer_reviews.text: It works just as advertised, except that it is a lot bigger in reality than it looks. Also, every once in a while, it'll pause on the screen for about half a second before lagging into its new position. The sensitivity changes randomly sometimes, but it's a software error and you need to upgrade the drivers to prevent that from happening. Oh, and there aren't Mac drivers so you the extra button's don't do anything.
customer_reviews.author: chopsoy

customer_reviews.title: BEST mouse i have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the mouse of the hour. being a hardcore PC gamer, a good mouse is very important. and the logitech G5 is really up for the task, with customizable weights, on the fly sensitivity changing (no software required), 5 button, 2 axis wheel, and great touch and feel makes this the ultimate gaming mouse out there. although the price tag is a little to high, but its nothing you will regret with playing a call of duty 4 online.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Osman

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: The G5 is awesome. My old Logitech optical mouse finally died, and this is exactly what I needed. The weight cartridge feature is helpful, the laser sensitivity settings are sweet, and the grip is comfy. It's not just a gaming mouse--I use it primarily for everyday applications. Having a good mouse makes a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: QuickerClicker

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: he G5 is a durable, well designed mouse. I have been using it for over a year now with no problems. It's very comfortable in the hand and the ability to add or subtract weight from it (by adding little weights that fit inside on the bottom) makes it perfect for the gamer. By adding or subtracting weight you can get the feel and the flow that you are looking for. i love the speed control and extra buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse out there
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best mouse on the market, though I have not tried the G9. I like it so much I have one for home and work. I love the weights and the rough grip. The precision is good and the reliability is much better than other mouses I have owned. Believe me when coding at 2 am and you get frustrated the mouse takes the brunt of my frustration and holds up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: B. Martens

customer_reviews.title: Like Cheating
customer_reviews.text: I have never spent money on any gaming hardware because I was in the mindset of, "this is just a game, I shouldn't spend money on hardware specifically for gaming". But this mouse is like cheating. The weight system is great, it is a huge improvement from normal mice with 1000 dpi, and is a very trusted brand. I probably won't be able to go back to any other mouse after this.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: full of features, fairly reliable, sensitivity is a bit fickle
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mouse, but when opening and using some programs on my PC, it increases the sensitivity automatically even when I don't want it to and don't press the adjusting buttons. This problem is fixed when I adjust the sensitivity control on the mouse, but it's still kind of annoying. Still a decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have used other Logitech mice in the past, so from those good experiences I tried this one and it did not disappoint. The mouse tracks well and has a comfortable feel. The buttons are in good locations also. I have been using the G5 (2 button thumb version) for a few months and would recommend it to anyone playing computer games. If you do not play computer games or just do not need the additional accuracy, get a less expensive model. Amazon saved me money on this purchase. I could not find it for less anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: QuickDraw

customer_reviews.title: my favorite mouse
customer_reviews.text: Cords always got in my way until I got this mouse. The cord is cloth like, and I can hardly tell it is there. All the buttons are programmable, in good spots, and feel of good quality. It could use more buttons. Otherwise, I love the feel and quality of it. I payed $50 for it too... at that price, it's an awesome mouse.

customer_reviews.title: Everything about it is quality.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this mouse. I had owned many "starter" mice and even some Razers, but nothing compares to the G5. From the add-on weights to the programmable buttons to the on-the-fly sensitivity changing, this mouse has it all. I love it, and will buy Logitech mice for life.
customer_reviews.author: Roderic Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: buttons..........
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever seen so many buttons? If you play fast online games like World of Warcraft, then you know the need to have macros on buttons is ever present. If you have more buttons to place macros on, then you can be the better player. And if that doesnt make you happy, then maybe you should be looking for a Hallmark card with balloons on it instead of a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Feel-good mouse
customer_reviews.text: I haven't yet investigated all the customizable features of this mouse but it does what I bought it for (work tasks, not gaming). It's very comfortable and the click wheel works very well. One nice touch is that you can press the click wheel on its sides to scroll left and right within applications and websites. I hadn't expected the USB cable to be quite as long as it is. I keep it bundled in the middle so it doesn't flop all over my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanmedia

customer_reviews.title: G5 Laser
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse and worth every dollar. 4 stars instead of 5 only because of the texture of the surface on the top. It looks a feels like cracked paint. Not suitable for an electronic precision device. Anyone should have this mouse. Its not only for games as Logitec pitches it.
customer_reviews.author: ValVe

customer_reviews.title: Overally good, but surface somehow gets sticky
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mouse for over a month. The buttons on the left are quite useful ( which I changed to "end" and "Ctrl". The only thing I feel bad about this mouse is the sticky surface, whenever my hand gets a little dirty and touches the mouse, the mouse suddenly gets uncomfortable to use. I don't know whether it's my personal issue or what. Overally, this mouse is perfect for gamers. Incredible dpi adjustment and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Song Liao

customer_reviews.title: Everything that they say it is
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is excellent. Much better game response... laser tracking is WAY better than plain old optical. Great shape, and the included weight kit lets you set up the perfect mechanical feel. The weights and the texture of the mouse make it feel almost like a deadly weapon!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Screen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse, for right handers that is. Lefty's need to look else where. I have average sized hands, the fit and comfort was perfect. I just recently moved to one of those WoW mouses, and I'm having a hard time getting used to it because this Logitech fit my hand so well it was ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Raptor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this mouse, it's my 2nd and I'll be trying to find the same when this one dies.
customer_reviews.author: CigarObsession

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, took a few days to get the weight I liked. I never realized my old logitech was so light until I got this one and now I want 2, one for work and this one at home. The switch on the fly settings are nice for gamming when you switch games or what you are doing in game.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Roach

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse! I had the previous version and loved it. This one adds a button and feels even better to the touch. I now own three for all my computers. I'm not a gamer, but find the precision and on-the-fly sensitivity adjustment helpful for photo work and other exacting tasks. And, it just feels GREAT in the hand. Significantly improves the computing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Works great. DPI selector is more useful than I first thought. The braided cord is nice plus, so that it can be kinked to avoid pulling on the mouse. Probably the best all-around mouse I've ever owned, and certainly the best corded mouse. I avoided buying it over the years because of the price, but for the price it has been going for recently, it's a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: W.F.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustments can be made to this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I don't have big hands for being 6' and this fits right in mine without cramping up after 12 hrs a day of use. I like that I can have a slower setting for some things and then speed it up when I need to on my rather large monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Cotosoti

customer_reviews.title: Solid gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: It is a solid performer and sits well in my right hand. I use it to play CS:S and love the weight cartridges because I can make it really light. :) The thumb buttons offer almost zero tactile feedback however so I can't tell whether I've pushed it.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen Chen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Photoshop users!
customer_reviews.text: I don't play video games. I use Photoshop and other Adobe graphics products for a living. This mouse has, in addition to the usual left and right buttons and a scroll wheel, SIX other programmable keys. You can see how I use them here: [...]
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Philpott

customer_reviews.title: great mouse ever! the newer g500 looks cooler though..
customer_reviews.text: this mouse is awesome! adjustable DPI, attached weight cartridge, stylish look, laser tech, man this is what you dreamed for! also, if you are a serious gamer, good at like SC2, WC3, WOW, etc, plz get WIRED mouse like this and avoid wireless ones ever!!! I owned a MX1100, cant say that's a dud but it really sucks when you play warcraft though it applies adjustable DPI and laser as well.
customer_reviews.author: Neol1oU

customer_reviews.title: Logitech NEW G5 Laser Mouse Review
customer_reviews.text: Love the mouse for gaming but the customizing software conflicts with Vista 32 on my gaming computer. Mouse is usable after uninstalling the software (Latest version from the website) but the extra features are missing. This is OK for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Just hope this one lasts. I will not buy a Microsoft mouse as they have a life of about 8 months at best. 2nd Logi mouse and love them. Very intuitive and ergonomically designed!!
customer_reviews.author: mptoledo

customer_reviews.title: Great corded mouse
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable in the hand. Great options and well placed buttons. Not using it for gaming so can't comment on that aspect. The Logitech software can be a bit balky and takes a surprisingly long time to install and update, but does the job once set up. Too bad the mouse doesn't come in a left hand version.
customer_reviews.author: Sleeping Tiger

customer_reviews.title: G5 versatile, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an MX 518. I really like the shift-on-the-fly dpi settings. Makes my gaming much more precise. I still haven't got a good feel for the weight system but the texture surface of the mouse gives you a nice solid grip. The software has more options than I can probably use but doesn't get in the way. Good price from Deal Barn and an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Case

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G5 Laser Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great laser mouse..I like how you can adjust the weights so that you can play games the way you want. I play a lot of first person shooting games...this is one the mouse where you can adjust the weights and sensitivity of the game you play...so far so good no complaints...love this mouse....
customer_reviews.author: Mike H. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse, made the purchase for my Boss, CEO/President and he LOVES it.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mouse, made the purchase for my Boss, CEO/President and he LOVES it. He is a gamer and needs an hi resolution mouse for several graphic programs, he has been using it a lot and made the other day with a big smile on his face, THIS IS AN AWESOME MOUSE I LIKE IT VERY MUCH, hi is very computer safy so 5 stars all over, oh he does not use the weights. So all stars all the way, good buy just wish it were a much cheaper mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Braun

customer_reviews.title: Thumb button too high, otherwise great mouse
customer_reviews.text: Logitech used to have a dual optical mouse with the thumb button right at the bottom. It allowed you to hit the thumb button without moving your thumb at all. Having to move your thumb up to hit the button is not a workable solution for me. Very disappointed they screwed it all up. There also needs to be additional degrees of sensitivity. Gap is too wide between medium and slow. Otherwise, this is a good mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketdad

customer_reviews.title: I've had two of these for years. They hold ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these for years. They hold up very well, except the material on the cord starts to wear off after a while.
customer_reviews.author: randomdude1978

customer_reviews.title: g5
customer_reviews.text: nice mouse,tracks well and feels better than most.really like that you can adjust sensitivity on the fly.now for the bad,the mouse buttons sometimes double click.if your trying to drag something it well release or try to open it depending on what it is.i use to have same problem with 518 after 6 month use so i thought i give the g5 a try,didn't last 2 weeks before doing it.wish they could fix this problem other than rma it back for another [...] bucks.rick
customer_reviews.author: R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G5 Laser Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse, still using it 2 years later. the weights included for balance, weights were a novelty and I stopped using them. otherwise no complaints. Love Logitech products, especially their mice.
customer_reviews.author: w33z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gamer mouse
customer_reviews.text: Best mouse ever used. The weights that come with this make it very customizable for your needs. Especially if you are a gamer. The buttons and feel have a nice touch. You can't go wrong with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph B. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Woot
customer_reviews.text: I already had a Logitech MX518 for my desktop, then I bought a laptop so I needed another. I decided to upgrade to the newest style of that design, the G5. It got here two days sooner than planned, and oh, how awesome it is.
customer_reviews.author: Songbirdo

customer_reviews.title: Gamers rejoice
customer_reviews.text: This thing is unbelievable. Logitech makes great mice. It is extremely responsive even on my slick desk that is covered with some sort of plastic. I can;t wait to get a good optical mouse pad for this. Great for FPS games.
customer_reviews.author: Binu G. Philip

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this along with my MSI GT725-075US gaming laptop. Perfect addition for ANY gamer who is looking for a mouse to go along with their PC! Thanks again Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Demiko Dracket

customer_reviews.title: No imperfections?
customer_reviews.text: well, theres nothing I dont like about this mouse. It's pretty great for the price and feels normal. The design is also great, so i dont have any complaints for it. But beware, dont try to open up the mouse if you have no clue what your doing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle L

customer_reviews.title: The best mouse I've ever used..bar none
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is near perfect in every way. The size is not to large or small. I love the ability to adjust the weights and speed of the mouse not to mention the movements are dead-on precise. When I got a new computer I gave away the mouse that came with and ordered a new G5 (I have an earlier version G5 so it was a no brainer). I had purchased many devices before I settled on the G5 in my journey to find one as good as possible. I'm going to purchase another as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: QuietWinds

customer_reviews.title: Worried at first, but store corrected issue.
customer_reviews.text: Originally I was sent a used mouse not in any original packaging. They said I was sent that one by mistake. They sent me a new one right away and I returned the used one. The mouse is fantastic. This is the second one I have bought. First one lasted 4+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: great but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This mouse definately makes a difference in FPS games. The only complaint I have,is that it needs about two more buttons for additional functions.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Burns

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a LONG while ago, it's a solid mouse.
customer_reviews.author: toddisit

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G5 Laser Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Very fluid movement and response. Comes with weights to adjust. Cool design that matches my overall system. Excellent mouse, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Black

customer_reviews.title: the best mouse to buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm debuting my new G5, and I say I'm very happy with the product. all know what a mouse is old, but until today I could not find a mouse like. previously had a Razer mamba, and indeed the G5 is better. I use itmainly to to play fps games . and I feel much more comfortable with the mouse I get flawless, in the days marked. very good seller. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Anibal Piñanez Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Favorite gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: For me, this is by far my favorite. It's the last of the easy to use abs setup mouses that I've come across. Great texture, color, and response.
customer_reviews.author: Tim E.

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse! Very accurate and compatible with any platform
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dell Dimension 5150 with FreeBSD 7.0 installed. Once it's plugged in, the FreeBSD(Unix) os recognized it in no time! The speed adjustment button works well, too. The performance is great! I'm pretty much sure than it will work great on any platform. My last Logitech MX510 worked for 4 years without any problem. I think this one will be good for at least 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Guoqin Ren

customer_reviews.title: there aren't enough buttons
customer_reviews.text: there aren't enough buttons. I want more buttons. and the grip isn't as good as the razor mouse.
customer_reviews.author: James William

customer_reviews.title: This mouse didnt stay in my house
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed the weight of this mouse but I didn't enjoy that it would accidentally change speeds on me (the speed button is right next to the scroll button). I really didn't like the fit either so I went with the MX-5 and I am very glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Grifter

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G5
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic mouse, once I received it it took a little bit getting used to the increased mouse speed. But now it's definitely my favorite mouse. The adjustable weights are a nice feature and so is the on the fly adjustable dpi. Both I don't use too much right now but it seems like i'll find a place for it later.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Deets

customer_reviews.title: The G5
customer_reviews.text: I never knew that a mouse change could improve your game so much. More control... feels good... faster.
customer_reviews.author: James U. Lewis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A great mouse with a some improvements for gamers.
customer_reviews.text: This model comes with a great improvements for gamers. The only thing here is that could takes a little time to adjust it to get a great precision.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Scualo

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This is, simply, the best gaming mouse ever made. The. Best. Nothing that Razer or Microsoft or Saitek or anyone else makes even comes close.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. Miglin

customer_reviews.title: great mouse for gaming and general use
customer_reviews.text: great product. would buy it again. works great on my dual op system with XP pro and Vista Ultimate.
customer_reviews.author: S.T. JUSTICE

customer_reviews.title: A good mouse some of the time
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is VERY responsive and nice to use SOME of the time. Other times it has a mind of its own. It takes a little getting used to as it feels a bit like sand paper. So I only gave it 3 stars because it is right down the middle of the road.
customer_reviews.author: Nibor  Diva Tsidun

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse for the intent of using it as a gaming mouse. It has been the best mouse I think I've ever used very nice feel, great sensitivity, and very easy to adjust your DPI for different applications.
customer_reviews.author: KrazyKidH2

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: The thing that sold me on this mouse was the 2 thumb buttons, i dont use the laser sensitivity buttons, they can be programed to do other functions.
customer_reviews.author: Seluryar

customer_reviews.title: My Boyfriend Loved It!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gaming mouse for my boyfriend who is into online gaming and whatever will help improve his performance. He loved this mouse!! The adjustable weight and dpi are great for his playing. He says he still wants to tweak it but overall, it is doing great!
customer_reviews.author: M. Krupa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gaming mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Best mouse I've ever had. The changeable weights are a nice feature. I like the feel of the mouse, even better than the first G5 edition. I also like the back and forward buttons on the side. It's great for gaming (I play World of Warcraft). Great price and fast shipping from Amazon as always. I woudl recommend this mouse to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Laser mouse
customer_reviews.text: the mouse works very well --no problems. I am not a gamer so can't rate it on use in games
customer_reviews.author: eileenjkb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for gaming and every day use. Is responsive and is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Anghel

customer_reviews.title: Exellent
customer_reviews.text: Wow. i actually got better at gaming (fps) very sturdy ergonomic design very comfortable in my hand. Custom weights are fun to use but... im not sure how much of a difference it makes. only problems is once in a while (once a month) the mouse dies for about 1/2 a second. buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Aqua

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G5 Laser Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Logitech G5 Laser Mouse is pretty cool. I'm using it right now. made for gamers. tired of getting shot at and can't seem to turn around to save yourself. well with this mouse you can. it has adjustable speed. also really good for sniping your opponent. also customize the weight on the mouse is pretty neat.
customer_reviews.author: Duong Tran

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this company to any customer looking for a product. They were very professional and responded to inquiries quickly. The first mouse had been lost in the mail and they sent out a replacement within 24 hours. The mouse arrived safely and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: CappiGirl

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G5...MUCH better than its successor, the G9
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this same G5 for about 3 years now and I will never own another mouse. Don't waste your money on the newer Logitech G9 because it can't compare to the G5. The Logitech G5 is the best mouse money can buy whether you're a gamer, graphic artist, web designer, or just a normal user. Buy it. You'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: N3TD3ViL

customer_reviews.title: Very Good & highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: - Love this product, been using it for years now with no problems, plus battery-free means a don't have to be tied-in with changing batteries all the time. - Very good and I highly recommended it to everyone, gamers or non gamers alike.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moli

customer_reviews.title: Cool mouse
customer_reviews.text: Very cool mouse. I always thought my mouse felt a little light when playing Call of Duty. When I read the reviews on the weight adjustments I had to have this mouse. It lived up to expectations. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: AWS

customer_reviews.title: ... same mouse for several years and I learned to love it. That was the reason
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same mouse for several years and I learned to love it. That was the reason, why I bought it a second time.
customer_reviews.author: firefox

customer_reviews.title: G5 Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This "Logitech G5 Gaming Mouse" passes all tests for any gaming requirements that you might have. I put my G7(wireless)in storage, no longer have any interrupts during a game.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Wilcoxon

product_meta.title: Logitech G5 USB Laser Gaming Mouse w/Adjustable Weight Cartridge
product_meta.description: Dominate the game!This Logitech G5 USB Laser Mouse is tuned for game domination. With the included adjustable weight cartridge you can use up to 36 grams of weight to customize your mouse with a heft and balance that s just right for your game! The 2000 dpi laser engine lets you experience the blinding speed and unequaled response of a 6.4 megapixels/second image processor. Adjustable sensitivity lets you shift from pixel-precise targeting to lightning-fast maneuvers, without pausing the action. With full speed USB you get blazing speed and instant acceleration from up to 1000 reports/second.Its right handed comfort grip is so natural it won't fatigue you. Forget sticky workarounds, with Polytetrafluoroethylene feet the G5 glides effortlessly across almost any surface! Take control of the game with this Logitech G5 Laser Mouse!
feature_bullets: Logitech G5 USB Laser Gaming Mouse General Features:
Full speed USB interface - up to 6.5-foot cable length (approximate) 2000 dpi Laser Engine
Right-handed comfort grip Certified for Windows Vista Polytetrafluoroethylene feet Controls:
Tilt wheel: Push wheel to either side to scroll horizontally + in game dpi increase

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars357 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
